(DVD NTSC) :|bsd., col. ;|c4 3/ 4 in. 500 Title from container. 500 Originally broadcast on the television program Screening room on WCVB, ABC's Channel 5, Boston, in April 1973. 500 Copyright notice: c2008 Studio 7 Arts. 506 Pacific Film Archive collection; non-circulating. Access by appt. only.|5CBPF. 511 0 Interviewer: Robert Gardner. 520 Robert Gardner interviews Jan Lenica about his life and work in 1973. He screened and discussed excerpts from his films Fantorro, Monsieur Tete, A and Labyrinth. Jan Lenica (1928-2001). In addition to being a celebrated animator, Jan Lenica was a multi-talented artist known for his poetic and surreal graphic art in many forms. Architect Jerzy Soltan appeared with Lenica. 538 DVD; NTSC; all regions; stereo. 590 PFA 0230-01-14038. |aCONDITION NOTE: Last checked: 2010/02 /11 Excellent condition. 600 10 Lenica, Jan|vInterviews. 650 0 Experimental films|xHistory and criticism. 650 0 Animators|vInterviews. 655 7 Television.|2mim 655 7 Talk shows.|2mim 655 7 Documentaries and factual works.|2mim 655 7 Animation.|2mim 700 1 Lenica, Jan. 700 1 Soltan, Jerzy. 700 1 Gardner, Robert,|d1925-2014 710 2 WCVB-TV (Television station : Boston, Mass.) 710 2 Studio 7 Arts (Firm) 710 2 Documentary Educational Resources (Firm) 730 02 Fantoro (Motion picture : 1972) 730 02 Monsieur Tete (Motion picture : 1959) 730 02 A (Motion picture : 1965) 730 02 Labirynt (Motion picture : 1963) 946 PFA 0230-01-14038.
